<@U23T4Q88L> Yes, please let me know if you find any issues with the newly revised tutorial, or can suggest any improvements! Thx. :slightly_smiling_face:
<@U1JB7QCBD|ashnur> has joined the channel
hi, so what do you mean it's dependent but not dependent
hey <@U1JB7QCBD> PoET is one consensus mechanism available in Sawtooth
but Sawtooth can support alternatives such as Quorom (included with Sawtooth) or PBFT if ported over from Fabric
You can think of Sawtooth as a framework or scaffolding to build a blockchain, you are able to plug in different network topologies, consensus mechanisms, and business logic, depending on your needs
Hello, are there Docker images to setup a network of validators like Fabric?
<@U24PWBB97> <@U0YQQRNU8> can probably point you in the right direction, i know there is a docker file in the sawtooth tools folder
<https://github.com/hyperledger/sawtooth-core/blob/master/tools/Dockerfile>

attachments.title: hyperledger/sawtooth-core
attachments.text: sawtooth-core - Core repository for Sawtooth Lake Distributed ledger

text: I'm not sure if that's up to date though, we recently consolidated repos
if you run the vagrant dev environemnt you can launch multiple validators
Thanks <@U0N3AJSSU> I was going to ask about the repos. So this is the old repo: <https://github.com/IntelLedger/sawtooth-core> ?
sawtooth-core is the new repo that merges together the old sawtooth-validator, sawtooth-docs, sawtooth-dev-tools, etc.
<@U24PWBB97> - only sawtooth-core matters (yay!). current docker file is in tools/ but is probably outdated.  it is on my todo to fix it up and do some more docker work this week
awesome. I'll use Vagrant for now. Thank you both!
ok, I'll drop notes here as docker work progresses
no problem, please stop back in if you have any questions :slightly_smiling_face:
<@U251ZDKJ5|sukrith> has joined the channel

Hello,
Just a quick Question: How do you change the consensus algorithm to Quorum Voting I went through the marketplace tutorial and it mentions PoET is the default consensus model. Is there a configuration parameter i have to change somewhere?
<@U251ZDKJ5> in the txnvalidator.js file LedgerType: ‘quorum'
thank you!
Another Quick question: has anybody built a front end in some JS framework for executing MarketPlace transactions?
im assuming this is possible using Marketplace Messages

I am interested to know the answer as well. Right now, I am building a prototype for a consortium of Canadian provinces (insurance regulators) and I am using Express, Node and HFC to interact with chaincode. Next step is to prototype using Sawtooth.  I don't know if there's a Node SDK?
<@U251ZDKJ5> <@U24PWBB97> we do have a JS framework to view the blockchain and issue transactions for marketplace
we haven't yet submitted it into open source but may be able to provide it in advance if you need it
That would be awesome. Even if it's an early release (with bugs) intended for developers...
yes! this would be super useful
<@U24PWBB97> <@U251ZDKJ5> do you guys have a timeframe on when you'd like the wallet/explorer webapp? we have two options
1) provide it under nda/sw eval agreement, which may be quicker
or 2) open source it which could be a week or two before we can make sure its ready
<@U0N3AJSSU> I can wait a few weeks. JS API is a nice to have - definitely not a deal breaker.

<@U24PWBB97> - in addition to the framework kelly mentioned, we do have a lower-level javascript library in sawtooth-core/clients/javascript.  includes code for working with the web api and creating/submitting signed messages.  there is a README.md in that directory with examples.
